sat_math_2024.subject: Math
sat_math_2024.description: College Board Digital SAT Math domains aligned to blueprint (Calculator section).

topics.title: Linear Equations
topics.summary: Solve for unknowns with inverse operations and balancing techniques.
objectives: Solve multi-step equations and inequalities.
Translate word problems into linear models.

topics.title: Systems of Equations
topics.summary: Analyze two-variable linear systems from real contexts.
objectives: Solve systems by substitution or elimination.
Interpret points of intersection in context.

topics.title: Linear Functions & Graphs
topics.summary: Slope, intercepts, transformations of lines.
objectives: Determine slope from tables or graphs.
Model scenarios using $y = mx + b$.

topics.title: Quadratic Functions
topics.summary: Vertex form, factoring, quadratic formula applications.
objectives: Factor quadratic expressions.
Solve quadratic equations (factoring, completing square, formula).
Analyze vertex and axis of symmetry.

topics.title: Function Composition & Inverses
topics.summary: Work with composite functions, even/odd, inverse relationships.
objectives: Evaluate composite functions at given values.
Determine if inverse is a function.
Describe transformations.

topics.title: Exponential Functions
topics.summary: Growth/decay models and logarithmic interpretation for SAT.
objectives: Interpret exponential growth parameters.
Solve exponential equations with logarithms.

domains.name: Problem Solving and Data Analysis
domains.summary: Ratios, proportional relationships, percentages, and statistics.

topics.title: Ratios and Proportions
topics.summary: Scale models, percent increase/decrease, unit rate comparisons.
objectives: Model proportional relationships.
Solve multi-step percent problems.
examples: If 3 kg cost $18, what is the cost of 7 kg?

topics.title: Percent Growth & Decay
topics.summary: Markup/markdown, compound percentage change, financial modeling.
objectives: Convert between percent and decimal multipliers.
Chain multiple percent changes.
examples: Item increased by 8% then discounted 15% — net change?

topics.title: Statistics & Probability
topics.summary: Center and spread, data interpretation, probability questions.
objectives: Compute mean, median, standard deviation insights.
Interpret scatterplots and two-way tables.
Use probability rules from context.

domains.name: Geometry and Trigonometry
domains.summary: Coordinate geometry, circles, and right-triangle trigonometry.

topics.title: Circle Relationships
topics.summary: Arc/angle properties, equation of a circle, chords, tangents.
objectives: Apply arc/angle relationships.
Use equation of a circle in coordinate plane.

topics.title: Coordinate Geometry
topics.summary: Parallel/perpendicular lines, midpoint, distance formula applications.
objectives: Classify triangles/quadrilaterals using coordinate proofs.
Calculate slope relationships and segment ratios.
examples: Show diagonals of a rectangle are congruent
Find point dividing segment in ratio

topics.title: Right Triangle Trigonometry
topics.summary: Basic sine/cosine/tangent, modeling with trig ratios.
objectives: Solve for missing sides using sine, cosine, tangent.
Interpret trig ratios in modeling questions.

ap_calculus_ab_bc.subject: Calculus AB/BC
ap_calculus_ab_bc.description: College Board AP Calculus course framework units.

topics.title: Limit Definition & Evaluation
topics.summary: Formal and numerical approaches to limits.
objectives: Evaluate limits algebraically and graphically.
Use one-sided limits and identify asymptotes.
Apply limit laws and squeeze theorem.
examples: Check continuity at $x=2$ for piecewise function

topics.title: Continuity and Theorems
topics.summary: Continuity on intervals, IVT, EVT.
objectives: Determine intervals of continuity.
Use Intermediate Value Theorem to justify solutions.
Apply Extreme Value Theorem to closed intervals.
examples: Show root exists between $x=1$ and $x=2$ for $f(x)=x^3-5$

topics.title: Derivative Rules
topics.summary: Power, product, quotient, chain, implicit differentiation.
objectives: Differentiate compositions using the chain rule.
Apply implicit differentiation to related functions.

topics.title: Related Rates
topics.summary: Model changing quantities using derivatives.
objectives: Translate verbal rates to derivative equations.
Solve problems involving geometry or motion.

topics.title: Curve Sketching & Optimization
topics.summary: Critical points, concavity, inflection points.
objectives: Use first/second derivative tests to classify extrema.
Solve optimization word problems.

topics.title: Motion along a Line
topics.summary: Velocity, acceleration, particle motion interpretation.
objectives: Analyze motion from position/velocity graphs.
Determine total distance travelled and direction changes.
examples: Given s(t), find when particle speeds up or slows down

topics.title: Integration Techniques
topics.summary: Antiderivatives, substitution, integration by parts (BC).
objectives: Evaluate definite integrals using substitution.
Apply integration by parts and partial fractions (BC).

topics.title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
topics.summary: Connect antiderivatives and area accumulation.
objectives: Use FTC to evaluate definite integrals.
Differentiate accumulation functions.

topics.title: Area & Volume
topics.summary: Area between curves, solids of revolution.
objectives: Compute area between intersecting curves.
Find volume using disk/washer/shell methods.
examples: Volume generated by rotating region around x-axis

topics.title: Differential Equations
topics.summary: Slope fields, separable equations, logistic models (BC).
objectives: Sketch slope fields and solution curves.
Solve separable differential equations.

topics.title: Convergence Tests
topics.summary: Integral, comparison, ratio, alternating series tests.
objectives: Determine convergence of positive term series.
Apply alternating series and ratio tests.

topics.title: Power & Taylor Series
topics.summary: Represent functions as power series and determine intervals of convergence.
objectives: Find Taylor series for common functions.
Use series to approximate function values.

igcse_mathematics.subject: Mathematics
igcse_mathematics.description: Cambridge IGCSE Mathematics (0580) 2025 exam cycle strands.

topics.title: Fractions & Percentages
topics.summary: Equivalent forms, recurring decimals, percentage change.
objectives: Convert between fractions, decimals, percentages.
Solve reverse percentage problems.

topics.title: Ratio, Rate and Proportion
topics.summary: Direct/inverse proportion, compound units, currency/timescale problems.
objectives: Model situations with direct or inverse proportions.
Manipulate compound measures (speed, density, pressure).
examples: Water tank filling with varying rate

topics.title: Standard Form
topics.summary: Work with numbers 10^n and scientific notation.
objectives: Convert large/small numbers to scientific notation.
Calculate with standard form.

topics.title: Expansion & Factorisation
topics.summary: Binomial expansion, factorising quadratics.
objectives: Expand $(ax + b)(cx + d)$.
Factorise $ax^2 + bx + c$.

topics.title: Simultaneous Equations
topics.summary: Linear-linear and linear-quadratic systems.
objectives: Solve simultaneous equations algebraically.
Interpret graphical solutions.

topics.title: Inequalities & Regions
topics.summary: Solve and graph inequalities, describe feasible regions.
objectives: Solve linear/quadratic inequalities.
Shade solution sets on number lines or coordinate planes.

topics.title: Sequences
topics.summary: Arithmetic/geometric sequences, nth term.
objectives: Find nth term formula.
Identify sequence type from patterns.

topics.title: Transformations
topics.summary: Reflection, rotation, enlargement, translation on coordinate grid.
objectives: Describe a transformation using matrix/vector notation.
Apply successive transformations.
examples: Describe transformation from shape A to B

topics.title: Vectors
topics.summary: Vector addition, scalar multiplication, proof with vectors.
objectives: Add vectors using column notation.
Use vectors to prove geometric results.

topics.title: Circle Geometry
topics.summary: Angles subtended by the same arc, cyclic quadrilaterals, tangents.
objectives: Apply circle theorems to prove relationships.
Solve for missing angles/lengths in circle diagrams.
examples: Opposite angles in cyclic quad sum to $180^\circ$
Tangents from a point are equal

topics.title: Surface Area & Volume
topics.summary: Prisms, cylinders, spheres, composite solids.
objectives: Calculate volume/surface area of standard solids.
Solve density/mass/volume problems.

topics.title: Data Handling
topics.summary: Stem-and-leaf, cumulative frequency, box plots.
objectives: Construct and interpret statistical diagrams.
Find median, quartiles from graphs.
examples: Draw cumulative frequency graph for height data

topics.title: Probability
topics.summary: Tree diagrams, conditional probability, expected value.
objectives: Use AND/OR rules for independent events.
Calculate expected number of outcomes.
examples: Probability of drawing two red balls without replacement

topics.title: Mixed Application Problems
topics.summary: Combine statistics and probability to interpret real contexts.
objectives: Compare data sets using summary statistics.
Apply probability to decision-making scenarios.
examples: Choose best product based on probability and payoff

alevel_mathematics.subject: Mathematics
alevel_mathematics.description: Cambridge International A Level Mathematics components.

domains.name: Pure Mathematics 1
domains.summary: Algebra, functions, coordinate geometry, calculus intro.

topics.title: Algebra & Functions
topics.summary: Manipulate polynomials, factor expressions, work with function notation.
objectives: Simplify rational expressions and algebraic fractions.
Solve quadratic and simultaneous equations.
Use composite and inverse functions.

topics.title: Coordinate Geometry
topics.summary: Lines, circles, and basic conic manipulation.
objectives: Find equations of lines given geometric constraints.
Use perpendicular/parallel conditions.
Determine intersection points of lines and circles.
examples: Show diagonals of a rhombus are perpendicular in coordinate form.

topics.title: Differentiation & Integration Intro
topics.summary: Basic derivative rules and anti-derivatives.
objectives: Differentiate polynomials and simple exponentials.
Apply differentiation to stationary points.
Integrate polynomials and use area interpretation.
examples: Find area under $y = x^2$ between $0$ and $2$

topics.title: Series & Binomial Expansions
topics.summary: Binomial theorem for positive integers, sigma notation basics.
objectives: Expand (a + bx)^n up to required powers.
Use sigma notation to express polynomial sums.

topics.title: Advanced Trigonometry
topics.summary: Trigonometric identities, compound angle formulae, R-form.
objectives: Manipulate trig identities and prove results.
Solve trig equations in specified intervals.
Use $R \cos(x \pm \alpha)$ or $R \sin(x \pm \alpha)$.
examples: Express $3\sin x + 4\cos x$ in the form $R \sin(x+\alpha)$.

topics.title: Further Differentiation & Integration
topics.summary: Implicit differentiation, integration using substitution/parts.
objectives: Differentiate ln, e^x, and implicit relationships.
Integrate via substitution and integration by parts.
Solve differential equations of the form dy/dx = f(x).

topics.title: Complex Numbers (Optional)
topics.summary: Introduce Argand diagram, modulus-argument form, De Moivre's theorem.
objectives: Plot complex numbers and find modulus/argument.
Use De Moivre's theorem to find powers/roots.

topics.title: Series & Sequences
topics.summary: Maclaurin/Taylor series, convergence tests.
objectives: Use Maclaurin expansions to approximate functions.
Determine convergence of geometric or binomial series.
examples: Find first three non-zero terms of $\ln(1+x)$.

topics.title: Polar Coordinates
topics.summary: Convert between Cartesian and polar, sketch polar curves.
objectives: Interpret graphs given in polar form.
Find area enclosed by polar curves.

topics.title: Further Differential Equations
topics.summary: Second-order linear differential equations, complementary & particular solutions.
objectives: Solve homogeneous 2nd-order differential equations.
Find general solution with particular integral.

topics.title: Kinematics
topics.summary: Motion in a straight line using calculus.
objectives: Use s-v-a relationships and calculus.
Interpret displacement-time and velocity-time graphs.

topics.title: Forces & Newton's Laws
topics.summary: Resolve forces, work with friction, solve connected particle problems.
objectives: Model forces on particles on horizontal/inclined planes.
Apply F = ma to systems with tension/friction.
examples: Two particles joined by light string over smooth pulley...

topics.title: Work, Energy, and Power
topics.summary: Energy conservation, work done by constant/variable forces, power equations.
objectives: Apply work-energy principle to motion problems.
Compute power for moving particles.
examples: Find velocity after moving 4m under constant force with friction.

topics.title: Distributions
topics.summary: Binomial and normal distribution modelling.
objectives: Calculate probabilities using binomial and normal approximations.
Standardize normal variables with mean μ, variance σ^2.

topics.title: Hypothesis Testing
topics.summary: One-tailed and two-tailed tests using binomial/normal models.
objectives: Formulate null/alternative hypotheses.
Use critical regions or p-values to conclude tests.
examples: Test whether a die is biased using binomial test.

topics.title: Correlation & Regression
topics.summary: Pearson/Spearman correlation, linear regression lines.
objectives: Calculate correlation coefficients from data.
Use regression lines for interpolation.
examples: Determine regression line of y on x and estimate y for given x.

igcse_additional_math_0606.subject: Mathematics (0606)
igcse_additional_math_0606.description: Cambridge IGCSE Additional Mathematics (0606) covering algebra, functions, calculus, and vectors.

domains.name: Advanced Algebra
domains.summary: Indices, surds, logarithms, and inequalities beyond core syllabus.

topics.title: Indices & Surds
topics.summary: Manipulate fractional indices, rationalize surds, solve equations.
objectives: Apply index laws for positive/negative/fractional indices.
Simplify and rationalize surd expressions.

topics.title: Logarithms
topics.summary: Laws of logarithms, change of base, solving exponential equations.
objectives: Use log laws to expand or combine expressions.
Solve equations involving e^x and ln x.

domains.name: Functions & Graphs
domains.summary: Quadratic inequalities, rational functions, transformation of graphs.

topics.title: Quadratic & Rational Inequalities
topics.summary: Solve inequalities using graph and algebraic factorization.
objectives: Represent solution sets on number lines.
Interpret inequalities using sign diagrams.

topics.title: Graph Transformation & Composite Functions
topics.summary: Apply translations, reflections, stretches on graphs; composite/inverse functions.
objectives: Write transformed functions in terms of originals.
Determine domain/range of composite functions.
examples: Describe transformation from y=f(x) to y=f(2x)+3

domains.name: Differentiation & Integration
domains.summary: Introductory calculus beyond IGCSE core syllabus.

topics.title: Differentiation
topics.summary: Differentiate polynomials, exponentials, products and quotients.
objectives: Find tangents/normals to curves.
Apply differentiation to optimization problems.
examples: Find stationary points of y = x e^{-x}

topics.title: Integration
topics.summary: Antiderivatives of polynomials and simple exponentials.
objectives: Evaluate definite integrals for area under curve.
Use integration to solve kinematics problems.

domains.name: Trigonometry & Vectors
domains.summary: Trigonometric identities, equations, and vector algebra.

topics.title: Trigonometric Identities & Equations
topics.summary: Use double-angle, sum-to-product identities, solve trig equations.
objectives: Prove identities using algebraic manipulation.
Solve equations within specified intervals.
examples: Solve 2sin x cos x = cos x for 0° ≤ x ≤ 360°

topics.title: Vectors
topics.summary: Vector addition, scalar product, magnitude/direction problems.
objectives: Resolve vectors into components.
Use dot product to find angle between vectors.
examples: Given AB = (3, -1), AC = (-2,4), find cos θ between vectors
